body_html:
No, using exact steps as described in the readme.md, but now I have found that changing the line:
set "PREBUILD_COMMAND=%VS140COMNTOOLS%....\VC\vcvarsall.bat"
to
set "PREBUILD_COMMAND=C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\VC\vcvarsall.bat"
results in:

Microsoft (R) Build Engine version 14.0.25420.1
Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

Build started 05.08.2018 17:56:16.
Project "c:\PY\Projects\pytorch\build\INSTALL.vcxproj" on node 1 (default targets).
Project "c:\PY\Projects\pytorch\build\INSTALL.vcxproj" (1) is building "C:\PY\Projects\pytorch\build\ZERO_CHECK.vcxproj" (2) on node 1 (default targets).
C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\Microsoft.Cpp\v4.0\V140\Microsoft.Cpp.Platform.targets(57,5): error MSB8020: The build tools for v141 (Platform Toolset = 'v 141') cannot be found. To build using the v141 build tools, please install v141 build tools. Alternatively, you may upgrade to the current Visual Studio t ools by selecting the Project menu or right-click the solution, and then selecting "Retarget solution". [C:\PY\Projects\pytorch\build\ZERO_CHECK.vcxproj]
Done Building Project "C:\PY\Projects\pytorch\build\ZERO_CHECK.vcxproj" (default targets) -- FAILED.

body:
No, using exact steps as described in the readme.md, but now I have found that changing the line:
set "PREBUILD_COMMAND=%VS140COMNTOOLS%\..\..\VC\vcvarsall.bat"
to
set "PREBUILD_COMMAND=C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\VC\vcvarsall.bat"
results in:

Microsoft (R) Build Engine version 14.0.25420.1
Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

Build started 05.08.2018 17:56:16.
Project "c:\PY\Projects\pytorch\build\INSTALL.vcxproj" on node 1 (default targets).
Project "c:\PY\Projects\pytorch\build\INSTALL.vcxproj" (1) is building "C:\PY\Projects\pytorch\build\ZERO_CHECK.vcxproj" (2) on node 1 (default targets).
C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\Microsoft.Cpp\v4.0\V140\Microsoft.Cpp.Platform.targets(57,5): error MSB8020: The build tools for v141 (Platform Toolset = 'v 141') cannot be found. To build using the v141 build tools, please install v141 build tools.  Alternatively, you may upgrade to the current Visual Studio t ools by selecting the Project menu or right-click the solution, and then selecting "Retarget solution". [C:\PY\Projects\pytorch\build\ZERO_CHECK.vcxproj]
Done Building Project "C:\PY\Projects\pytorch\build\ZERO_CHECK.vcxproj" (default targets) -- FAILED.
